subSections.title: Glyph origin
Definitions
Usage notes
subSections.text: In mainland China and among its expatriates, this surname is generally romanized as "[[Li]]" in accordance with the {{w|Hanyu Pinyin}} system. Although an identical transliteration is used in {{w|Wade-Giles}}, similarity to the English surname has made the romanization "[[Lee]]" more common in Hong Kong and Taiwan. A notable example of this is {{w|Bruce Lee}}.
